duties_responsibilities.duty: Formulate policies, manage daily operations, and plan the use of materials and human resources for management of aircraft maintenance operations.
Ensure airworthiness of the Special Air Mission (SAM) aircraft fleet transporting high-ranking national and international dignitaries.
Responsible for work control, planning, and implementing company safety and environmental protection policies.
Direct maintenance, repair, and operation of all assigned systems and supporting infrastructure affecting aircraft airworthiness.
Implement daily flying schedules to ensure all aircraft requirements are met.
Chair the daily maintenance planning and scheduling meetings.
Serve as the point of contact for all aircraft maintenance and issues relating to aircraft operations mission support.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Air Force/civilian aircraft maintenance and fifteen or more years in a DOD and or Civilian operations management environment.
FAA certificate mechanic with an airframe and power plant rating.
